title: Corbynites are using the prospect of an election to tighten the far-Left's grip on Labour
text:
News emerged last night that Ian Murray, the last man standing after Scottish Labour’s dramatic wipe-out in 2015, is to be the target of the Unite trade union, who want to dispense with Murray’s services and, presumably, replace him with a candidate who is more likely to toe the Corbyn/Len McCluskey line.

Even by Unite’s standards it’s a demented move. Two years after all 40 of Murray’s Scottish Labour colleagues were sent packing by the electorate, leaving him as Labour’s sole Westminster parliamentarian north of the border, Murray was re-elected in his Edinburgh South seat with an increase in his vote of 6,976. Across the whole of Scotland at that same election, Labour’s total vote increased...
description: News emerged last night that Ian Murray, the last man standing after Scottish Labour’s dramatic wipe-out in 2015, is to be the target of the Unite trade union, who want to dispense with Murray’s services and, presumably, replace him with a candidate who is more likely to toe the Corbyn/Len McCluskey line.
